heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Health Act 
1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) Regulations 
2021 (S.I. No. 217 of 2021).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean health act 1947 (section 31a - temporary restrictions) (covid-19) (no 2) regulation 2021 (s.i no 217 2021)

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 3. Regulation 13 of the Principal Regulations is amended -
text_raw:
3. Regulation 13 of the Principal Regulations is amended - 

(a) 

by the substitution, in paragraph (1)(b)(ii), of the following 
subclause for subclause (I): 

“(I) members of the public are not permitted, or 
otherwise granted, access to a part of a 
relevant premises that is indoors, or permitted 
to remain in an indoor part of such premises, 
other than for as long as is strictly required for 
the purposes of - 

(A) accessing an indoor toilet facility, 

(B) ordering or collecting, or both, food or 
beverages for consumption off such 
premises, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th July, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [322] 3 

(C) paying for goods sold or services 
provided, or both, at the premises, 

(D) accessing an outdoor seating area or 

smoking area, or 

(E) accessing, for unavoidable reasons of an 
emergency nature, indoor parts of the 
premises to protect a person’s health or 
welfare,”, 

(b) by the substitution, in paragraph (1)(b)(ii), of the following 

subclause for subclause (II): 

“(II) members of the public other than relevant 
guests are not permitted, or otherwise granted, 
access to a part of a relevant accommodation 
premises that is indoors, or permitted to 
remain in an indoor part of such premises, 
other than for as long as is strictly required for 
the purposes of - 

(A) accessing an indoor toilet facility, 

(B) ordering or collecting, or both, food or 
beverages for consumption off such 
premises, 

(C) paying for goods sold or services 
provided, or both, at the premises, 

(D) accessing an outdoor seating area or 

smoking area, or 

(E) accessing, for unavoidable reasons of an 
emergency nature, indoor parts of the 
premises to protect a person’s health or 
welfare,”, and 

(c) 

in paragraph (5), by 
subparagraph for subparagraph (a): 

the substitution of 

the following 

“(a) A specified person shall ensure that members of the 

public are not, during the specified period - 

(i) 

permitted, or otherwise granted, access to a 
specified premises, or 

(ii) permitted to remain on a specified premises, 

other than for as long as is strictly required for the 
purposes of - 

(I) 

accessing an indoor toilet facility, 

(II) ordering or collecting, or both, food or 
beverages for consumption off such premises, 

(III) paying for goods sold or services provided, or 

both, at the premises, or 

 
 4 [322] 

(IV) accessing, for unavoidable reasons of an 
emergency nature, indoor parts of the premises 
to protect a person’s health or welfare.”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 217 of 2021) to 
make amendments to the list of “Scheduled Events”, and to allow for indoor 
access to relevant premises, specified premises and relevant accommodation 
premises for use of toilet facilities and for other specific and limited reasons. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [322] 9
